item.title: Sloppy code - Exam Totals
item.dc:creator: @Frantix Frantix
item.description:
@Frantix wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:2, topic:545128”]Please don’t use mysql_ functions anymore, it’s not 2008. Here’s an example of what your first part of code would be while using MySQLi, a much more advanced system.
[php]
$MySQLi = new mysqli(“localhost”, “my_user”, “my_password”, “users”);

$query = “SELECT * FROM users WHERE userid=’$userid’”;
$user_score = $MySQLi->query($query);

$scores = $user_score->fetch_array(MYSQLI_ASSOC);
[/php]

Now, you’ve been posting here for a while focusing around website development and what I remember you’ve posted quite a bit of PHP exam questions, what I’ll do is leave you with the array_sum() function and tell you that you need to edit your database storage. For example, rather than $scores[‘quiz1a1’] + $scores[‘quiz1a4’] it should be returned as something more interpretable such as $generalScores[1], that way you can use the array_sum() function and voila, job done.

Disclaimer: I’ve not touched PHP in a long while, some of this information may be a little outdated or even false, but it’ll work better than what you have now.[/quote]

Ok thanks, ill give that a shot I was thinking of using an array. Ill get back to you shortly. Thanks

Justin Bieber:

Is the objective to just clean up the PHP, or the database too? It doesn’t look like it’s been normalised rofl

Cleaning both preferably but tbh this seems like the only way to do the database sided bit. So basically, “quiz1a1” in the database would be where the users score is entered in the database.

Read full topic

item.title: Sloppy code - Exam Totals
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Please don’t use mysql_ functions anymore, it’s not 2008. Here’s an example of what your first part of code would be while using MySQLi, a much more advanced system.
[php]
$MySQLi = new mysqli(“localhost”, “my_user”, “my_password”, “users”);

$query = “SELECT * FROM users WHERE userid=’$userid’”;
$user_score = $MySQLi->query($query);

$scores = $user_score->fetch_array(MYSQLI_ASSOC);
[/php]

Now, you’ve been posting here for a while focusing around website development and what I remember you’ve posted quite a bit of PHP exam questions, what I’ll do is leave you with the array_sum() function and tell you that you need to edit your database storage. For example, rather than $scores[‘quiz1a1’] + $scores[‘quiz1a4’] it should be returned as something more interpretable such as $generalScores[1], that way you can use the array_sum() function and voila, job done.

Disclaimer: I’ve not touched PHP in a long while, some of this information may be a little outdated or even false, but it’ll work better than what you have now.

Read full topic

item.title: Sloppy code - Exam Totals
item.dc:creator: @Frantix Frantix
item.description:
@Frantix wrote:

Would there be a better way of doing this without using so much code lmfao. This is for an online exam this is how it works out the totals for each category. Thank you <3 <3

$user_score = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM users WHERE userid='$userid'") or die (mysql_error()); while ($scores=mysql_fetch_array($user_score)){ $internet = $scores['quiz1a17'] + $scores['quiz1a18'] + $scores['quiz1a20'] + $scores['quiz1a21'] + $scores['quiz1a23'] + $scores['quiz1a34'] + $scores['quiz1a43'] + $scores['quiz1a44']; $word = $scores['quiz1a2'] + $scores['quiz1a3'] + $scores['quiz1a6'] + $scores['quiz1a15'] + $scores['quiz1a16'] + $scores['quiz1a28'] + $scores['quiz1a29'] + $scores['quiz1a30']; $general = $scores['quiz1a1'] + $scores['quiz1a4'] + $scores['quiz1a5'] + $scores['quiz1a33'] + $scores['quiz1a45']; $spreadsheets = $scores['quiz1a7'] + $scores['quiz1a10'] + $scores['quiz1a11'] + $scores['quiz1a12'] + $scores['quiz1a13'] + $scores['quiz1a24'] + $scores['quiz1a25'] + $scores['quiz1a36'] + $scores['quiz1a37'] + $scores['quiz1a38'] + $scores['quiz1a27']; $graphics = $scores['quiz1a8'] + $scores['quiz1a9'] + $scores['quiz1a17'] + $scores['quiz1a26'] + $scores['quiz1a31'] + $scores['quiz1a39'] + $scores['quiz1a40']; $programming = $scores['quiz1a22'] + $scores['quiz1a25'] + $scores['quiz1a32'] + $scores['quiz1a35'] + $scores['quiz1a41'] + $scores['quiz1a42']; }
